overview:
Gregory C. Kim serves as Chief Strategy Officer and Chief Marketing Officer at Savings.com, a rapidly growing aggregator of the best deals and coupons on the web. Prior to Savings.com, Mr. Kim served as Senior Vice President, Strategy & Corporate Development at People Media where he built out the team, infrastructure, website and roadmap to build a global leader in niche dating. People Media was sold to Match.com/InterActiveCorp for $80 million in cash in July 2009. Prior to People Media, Mr. Kim was Senior Director of Strategy & Corporate Development at LowerMyBills.com and helped the company become a category killer in comparison shopping for services and a lead generation platform in home loans, education and insurance. During Mr. Kim’s tenure, LowerMyBills.com grew from $10 million to $250 million in revenues in 3 years and the company was sold to Experian for $330 million plus earn-out. Prior to LowerMyBills.com, Mr. Kim was an investment banker with Houlihan Lokey Howard & Zukin where he worked on engagements across all product and industry groups and clients from startups to Fortune 500 companies.

Mr. Kim earned his M.B.A. in Entrepreneurial Studies and Finance from the The Anderson School at UCLA, and graduated from The Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania with a B.S. in Economics.
